Hopefully you‚Äôll be back to planning group rides at some point in the future xx
@misscharlesyork @YorkList @EnvAgencyYNE @theyorkmix Thanks for passing that on.
@YorkBikeBelles @YorkList @EnvAgencyYNE That is a lovely walk, I do believe at the moment quite slippy‚Ä¶ I had a caller today say they were slipping and sliding. #ice #besafe @theyorkmix

@YorkList @misscharlesyork The #York Millennium Bridge/Skeltergate Bridge loop taking in Terry Avenue and New Walk is a lovely, easy tree-lined route with river views. It's not usually muddy (unless the river recently flooded). But do it quick as the @EnvAgencyYNE will be closing Terry Avenue soon!
@misscharlesyork can you recommend any close to York that arent too muddy?

An officer took this stunning picture in Aldeburgh üòç

He was out checking the timber groynes to make sure they had the correct signage and safety messages. 

#Suffolk #Sunrise https://t.co/Tf3eCNAlUk
@Longmuir19 @CanalRiverTrust It was going to be removed the week before Christmas, but #Tier4 intervened. Are there any fresh plans do  you know @Charlie_Bil  ? #Thames #Eton #Windsor

tweets.text: #livingwithwater #westHull #Derringham #community #aquagreen @LivingWithH2O @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/lk7DlsEROr

Keeping rivers free of debris is a key task for our local field teams. 

Officers from #Teamea have been in #Leigh making sure the river is running clear. 

We've removed the rubbish found including the pallets! https://t.co/ANhKPFjQbj

Take your knowledge further with a Flood and Coastal Engineering MSc. 

Scholarships are available, full time for one year starting in September 2021 and will include a 3 month work placement at the @EnvAgency (subject to terms and conditions).

Apply now: https://t.co/cStzUAbhhi https://t.co/fnWS5slTWK

Congratulations to @EnvAgency colleagues Rachael Hill, Carol Holt & Peter Spencer recognised in the #NewYearsHonours. They work to keep us safe from #flood - #TeamEA https://t.co/GOV6R6onQI https://t.co/vPKpfT905r

Visit https://t.co/JJIcU3M5dy to keep up to date and feed into our plans with @eaststaffsbc and @EnvAgencyMids to deliver the #WashlandsVision. We will be carrying out ground investigations in January to help inform the plans. https://t.co/bKoBqg9JMa

A large jack up barge left the River Hull today after being used for 2 years to install 650m of piling as part of the ¬£62.4 million project to improve the defences.

The project will better protect more than 60,000 homes and businesses in #Hull from #flooding. https://t.co/mSz0MNyagO

@ecoevoenviro @michaelst1001 @EnvAgency Agree its a calculation that needs to be made. However what we do know is that operating at capacity the Rivenhall incinerator would need 600 ktpa to keep it fed and would rely on importing waste into Essex - every tonne by road. Thats a big loading on that side of the equation.

@JamesAbbott2013 @michaelst1001 @EnvAgency How does the incinerator footprint compare to alternative waste management? For example lifetime of landfill or export as much of Southern UK metal and 
plastic  waste ends up on ships

Great video of the jack-up barge we have been using for the 2 years as part of a ¬£64m project to improve defences leaving the River Hull. 

The scheme will better protect more than 60,000 homes & businesses in Hull from #flooding & make the city more resilient to #climatechange. https://t.co/9H7enKc6Ki

urls.title: UK study investigates microplastic pollution from roads
urls.description: Highways England is looking at whether microplastics are washed off roads and into the environment.

tweets.text: #Essex Forest Initiative aims to plant 375,000 trees in county which its estimated will take up about 60,000 tonnes of CO2.  Proposed #Rivenhall waste incinerator, granted a permit by the "environment" agency @EnvAgency will emit approx. ten times that amount of CO2 - every year.
